original: Benktsson, Benkt-Åke, skådespelare o. regissör, Göteborg, f. 6/1/07 i Halmstad av köpm. Hans B. o. Anna Maria Kull. G. 44 m. Karin Lilja. Barn: Hans Ake Kristian f. 47. — Realex. i Hälsingborg 22, ex. v. hand:gymri. 24, teaterstud. f. Karin Alexandersson, Ebba Blickingberg, Judith Lind^e-nau o. Leonid Sibirzeff. Studires. t. Finl. o. Balticum 35, Sovjetunionen 36, Polen 37, Engl. 38, Ungern 39 saifit t. Danm. Elev v. Hälsingborgs stadsteater und. Torsten Hammarén 25-26, debut, där s. Gregorsson i National-monumentet av Tor Hedberg 26, eng. v. Lorensbergsteatern i Gbg 26-34, knuten t. Stadsteatern i Gbg sed. den start., regissör v. Lisebergs Nöjesfält 29-32, eng. v. Karl-Gerhards revyensemble sommarsäsong. 33, 34 o. 37, v. Dramatens ensemble 40, Vasateatern 43, Oscarsteatern 44, dessutom fem sommarsäsong, v. Pildammsteatern i Malmö und. Oscar Winge. Rektor f. Gbgs’ Stad&teat. elevsk. 44. Bl. rollerna märks en rad Shakespeareroller ss. Dödgrävaren i Hamlet, Proba i Som Ni behagar, Tobias Raap i Trettondagsafton o. Falstaff i Muntra Fruarna i WindsoT, b’l. övriga roller kan nämnas: Pater Lorentz i Kaj Munks Niels Ebbesen, Balettmästaren i Koppla av, Nick i Saroyans Livets lek o. BloomfieM-Bonington i Bernard Shav^s Doktorns dilemma. Medl. av SäWfsk. Gnistan o. TSO, ordensgeneral i moderilogen av TSO 44-46, ordf. i Sv. musikerförb. avd. 2 sed. 46 samt ordf. i dess teatersekt., hediordf. i Gbgs fiilmsällsk. sed. 4L Medl. av Frimurarorden. Hobbies: primitiv konst, spec. masker samt slavisk kulturhist. Håll. ett 100-tal föreläsn. i dessa ämnen. RLSF ftjitS 47, FMM 40.
translated: Benktsson, Benkt-Åke, actor and director, born in Göteborg on January 6th, 1907 to a merchant, Hans B., and Anna Maria Kull. Married to Karin Lilja since 1944, with one child, Hans Ake Kristian, born in 1947. Completed Realexamen in Hälsingborg in 1922, then commerce courses and gymnasium for commerce in 1924. Studied theater with Karin Alexandersson, Ebba Blickingberg, Judith Lindénau, and Leonid Sibirzeff. Further studies in Finland and the Baltic States in 1935, Soviet Union in 1936, Poland in 1937, England in 1938, and Hungary in 1939, and then in Denmark. Was an apprentice at Hälsingborg city theater under Torsten Hammarén from 1925-1926, and made debut as S. Gregorsson in National-monumentet by Tor Hedberg in 1926. Worked at Lorensbergsteatern in Göteborg from 1926-1934, then with Stadsteatern in Göteborg from the opening of the theater. Was a director at Lisebergs Nöjesfält from 1929-1932 and with Karl-Gerhards revyensemble during the summer seasons of 1933, 1934, and 1937. Was with the ensemble at Dramaten in 1940, Vasateatern in 1943, Oscarsteatern in 1944, and also had five summer seasons at Pildammsteatern in Malmö under Oscar Winge. Became the rektor (head) of Gbg's Stadteat. elevsk. in 1944. Played leading roles in Shakespeare's plays like Dödgrävaren in Hamlet, Proba in Som Ni behagar, Tobias Raap in Trettondagsafton, and Falstaff in Muntra Fruarna i Windsot, among others such as Pater Lorentz in Kaj Munks Niels Ebbesen, Balettmästaren in Koppla av, Nick in Saroyan's Livets lek, and Bloomfield-Bonington in Bernard Shaw's Doktorns dilemma. Member of SäIlsk. Gnistan and TSO, and was an ordensgeneral (commander) in the mother lodge of TSO from 1944-1946, also served as the chairman of the Swedish Musicians' Union's section 2 since 1946, and chairman of its theater section. Was the honorary chairman of Gbg's filmsällsk. since 1941, and a member of the Freemason's Order. Hobbies include primitive art, especially masks, and Slavic cultural history. Has given around 100 lectures on these subjects. Received RLSF in 1947 and FMM in 1940.

structured.name: Benkt-Åke Benktsson
structured.description: Benkt-Åke Benktsson was a Swedish actor and director, known for his work in Shakespeare plays and for his interest in primitive art and Slavic cultural history.
